alert.note: Alert for Bureau; La Salle; Putnam (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Chicago (Northeastern Illinois and Northwestern Indiana)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued March 30 at 8:47PM CDT until April 05 at 7:00AM CDT by NWS Chicago
info.description: ...The Flood Watch is extended for the following rivers in Illinois... Illinois River at La Salle affecting La Salle, Bureau and Putnam zones. For the Illinois River (Upper)...including La Salle...flooding is possible. ...FLOOD WATCH NOW IN EFFECT FROM LATE THURSDAY NIGHT TO TUESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding is possible. * WHERE...Illinois River at La Salle. * WHEN...From late Thursday night to Tuesday morning. * IMPACTS...At 22.0 feet, Lower parking lot at Starved Rock State Park is inundated east of La Salle. High water levels begin to impact shipping interests along the river. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:45 PM CDT Wednesday the stage was 17.1 feet. - Forecast...Flood stage may be reached early Friday morning. - Flood stage is 20.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: These forecasts are based on observed precipitation as well as forecast precipitation 48 hours into the future. Changes to the rainfall forecast, or any additional rainfall after 48 hours, may cause changes to these river forecasts. A Flood Watch means water levels above flood stage are possible, but not yet certain, based upon the latest forecasts. Persons along rivers and streams in the watch area should monitor the latest forecasts and be prepared to take action should flooding develop. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/Chicago and water.weather.gov The next statement is expected by late Thursday morning.
